content.description: Sit start with a low left hand edge and a high right hand edge. From there, gain a left hand edge, crank up and match, and follow to the featured slab and an easy finish.
content.protection: A pad will do. The landing is good.
content.location: It climbs the east side of the boulder's northeast arete.

content.description: Sit start matched on the diagonal undercling. From there, bump the left hand up the undercling while working small right edges, overcome the lip, and finish up the easy slab.
content.protection: A pair of pads. The landing is very good.
content.location: It climbs the north face of the boulder.

content.description: Sit start matched on the undercling. From there, stick a big, right hand pinch, follow to small, left hand edge, reach a right hand undercling, follow to the lip, and use the hueco to gain the slab and an easy finish.
content.protection: A pair of pads. The landing is great, but there is a downed tree behind the fall zone.
content.location:
It climbs the northwest arete of the boulder. Do the same start as

Zen Arcade

.

content.description: Sit start at the arete. From there, match on the triangular sloper above, gain the underling on the prominent nose, and continue up the nose wrapping around the east side to reach an easy mantel.
content.protection: A pair of pads. The landing is riddled with a few rocks.
content.location: It climb the south face nose of the boulder.

content.description: Sit start with a pair of small, sidepull edges. From there, gain the large, sloping edge, then use a left hand sidepull and right hand sidepull to reach the lip and an easy mantel.
content.protection: The landing is a little crowded with the tree and rocks, but it pads well. Use two pads at least.
content.location: It climbs the boulder's south face.

content.description: Sit start with a right hand edge and a left hand pocket. From there, stick a big right hand jug, stack a left hand on top with a great sidepull, achieve footing, reach the lip, and top it out.
content.protection: A pad or two. The landing is good.
content.location: It climbs the north face of the boulder, at the northeast arete.

content.description: Sit start matched on an obvious edge. From there, climb through pinches, edges, and incuts to reach an easy mantel.
content.protection: A pair of pads. The landing doesn't get any better.
content.location: It climbs near the center of the boulder's west face.

content.description: Stand start with sidepulls. From there, traverse left through edges to the shelf and an easy mantel.
content.protection: A pair of pads. The landing is spectacular.
content.location: It climbs the west face of boulder.

content.description: Sit start with edges. From there, traverse right along the prominent undercling to its terminus, then continue up through dirty jugs to reach an easy mantel.
content.protection: A pair of pads. The landing is flat and clear throughout.
content.location: It climbs the boulder's west face.

content.description: Sit start with edges. From there, use the giant left hand pinch, gain the right hand undercling, follow to the arete, gain the apex edge and then the jugs, and mantel for an easy finish.
content.protection: A pair of pads. The landing is superb.
content.location: It climbs the west side of the boulder's northwest arete.

content.description: Sit start with a left hand edge and a great right hand sidepull down low. From there, ascend the crimp-strewn face to reach an easy mantel.
content.protection: A pair of pads. The landing is good, but there is a rock just left/behind of the fall zone.
content.location: It climbs the west face of the boulder.

content.description: Stand start with edges. From there, use the sidepull to achieve the jug, then follow the diagonal seam to the lip, and mantel atop the boulder.
content.protection: A pair of pads. The landing is shared with a rock that pads well.
content.location: It climbs the boulder's west face.
